title: Ping spikes randomly through the roof
body:
So ill join. A game with 40 ping and after a minute from spawn my ping will jump to 200 then 900 and stay between there. This Only started after i got patch 6.6...is anyone else experiencing this? I tried all troubleshooting and im almost completly sure it isnt my internet. I tried playing other games and they all ran smoothly but not league. Please help.

If anyone else is having issues please let me know. I hope im not the only one

Edit: Its been 2 days of this lag. Ive troubleshooted everything and im almost positive its not on my end. Please let me know if im not the only one!

Riot as you can see there is not a problem on our end. Clearly its a server issue due to the new patch. Issues arriving after the update should not be left untreated. Please help


Edit: I saw one tip to flush your DNS. I dont know if it works, havent got the time to try, but if someone could and see if it helps please let us know. Btw DNS flushing dosent harm your computer or delete anything if you (reader) are wondering

replies.body:
If you've already gone through the [Connection Troubleshooting](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) steps, then I'd recommend opening up a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/anonymous_requests/new) since we'll need to take a closer look at your individual setup.

Make sure to submit the relevant [network logs](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674#jwq1) (Network Analysis, NetworkInfo, and Process List) to help speed up the process :)  Let me know if you run into any problems with the ticket process

> [{quoted}](name=RiotBok,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=OrY6s7hX,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-03-26T00:28:31.842+0000)
>
> If you've already gone through the [Connection Troubleshooting](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) steps, then I'd recommend opening up a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/anonymous_requests/new) since we'll need to take a closer look at your individual setup.
> 
> Make sure to submit the relevant [network logs](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674#jwq1) (Network Analysis, NetworkInfo, and Process List) to help speed up the process :)  Let me know if you run into any problems with the ticket process

Just curious as to why you guys won't take responsibility for the issue? We all know its not a problem with our end and its only happening to mac users after patch 6.6?
Not just mac users, I am using Windows 10.
Win 7 here and I have random huge lag spikes (didnt have em for long time, now its happening once again)
agreed it isn't just Mac
This actually fixed it for me! Thanks so much

what did you do
???
the original comment this conversation is towards is what helped me I think
I would also like to know the solution, this is not on my end, it is something having to do with riot
Having a similar problem, normally my ping stays on 26 which is great, but after the new patch, I will randomly jumps to 300~1000, it really ruins the game experience.
Exactly!
EXACTLY! thank you! Lets get this post some attention so Riot makes a freakin change!!!

Just was in a series game we are winning pushing inhibitors had a good turret/kill/ gold lead i am assuming. and ping goes up to 3000. lovely...

prior to this patch i could be streaming netflix my roommate could be playing streetfighter v on the ps and downloading a movie and my in game ping would be 30 now i am at 200-300 frequently. tired other games no difference at all only occurring in league and even happens when i am doing literally nothing else over the internet. i run a speedtest and my shit is still off the charts good. 

now i don't even know if i lost that game and thus lost my series because league wont even let me log back into the fucking game. 

please fix this patch.
It really is not an issue on our part

I'd like to add myself to this list of victims.  I've tried the DNS flushing and ip renewals, but nothing seemed to fix the lag.  I've already submitted my ticket and eagerly awaiting assistance :c

Just to be clear, the only thing happening is that I'm suffering from massive lag only in League. This happened after my client crashed when I had queued for a ranked game.

I honestly just dont understand why they cant see this problem. There are ao many people who just cant play now because of 6.6. It makes the game terrible and your teams angry. They really need to fix this lag issue

I've been having the same issue. I've noticed, too, that it seems to only be happening when I queue up in draft. Not in blind. my last 2 draft games ended with me having to manually shut my comp off bc the game just froze. Went from 38 ping & not even 3 mins in I couldn't even see movement/sound. Cursor was responsive but the actual game looked like a screen shot. Couldn't even tab out/ctl+alt+del. Positive it's not my internet. Sorry I can't help but ty for posting. would like to know if its something I can fix
I had that same issue in aram. Was playing and scrreen froze but sound and cursor were still active. Im 100% sure it isnt my internet because i can play games like CSGO smoothly :/

So I know this thread was last year, but I am having the same problem as all of you guys. I started playing LoL on this laptop, and for 2-3 days, the game ran fine, no ms lag spike, then all the sudden, it happened. I'd start a game and as soon as the minions start slashing at each other, the monstrous lags start, and they just keep going with no end. 150-800 ms until I get disconnected. I tried mostly every fix possible, checked my internet connection, which fine btw, and nothing is the matter, except when I start playing LoL. Did riot fix this problem or was it ignored?

i get into a game and my ping is fine until 20minutes-the end of the game. this has been happening for two weeks now. fix your game, its been like this ever since you got rid of legacy client. this alpha client is a beta af. fix your game its so bad. my ping would be at 65 and it spikes out of nowhere and doesn't even show my ping going up. it just spikes. your game sucks. riot sucks. why is your game still alive

I get into game with a steady 70 ping or so to 72, but for some reason the past week or so, I will have my normal ping at the beginning, but then it shoots to the 500's and 1000's I am seriously ready to quit league because of this problem with Riot's game, thanks for nothing Riot.
already made a ticket. hope this stops soon. No way to play
Are you Canadian by any chance? I'm asking because I noticed quite a few of us are having trouble connecting from Southern Ontario and am interested to know if this is related to your issue.

Hi, I live in southern Ontario and I experience terrible lag spikes. My usual ping is around 25-45ms and then it spikes to 250-500ms every 10 seconds. It's really frustrating to play with. Are you form Ontario as well? And if so have you resolved your latency issues?
im not, sorry
No problem! Perhaps it's not an ISP related issue then for a lot of us. The game is basically unplayable with these drops. Hopefully they'll be able to tackle the issue ASAP.
The only thing they fix are things that allow you to smoothly advance through the ranked leader-boards. Since they sell higher elo accounts.
Am also having this issue, Riot for god sake fix your game!

i start off on 90ish and as soon as the minions begin to fight my ping goes skyward, jumps to 200, then like 450, then like 800 and continually fluctuates until i die, my fps is great for me, (60-80capped). i tried low graphics, high grapics, nothing running except league still lagg, changed my address on my computer to get higher priority from my router, did the ipconfig/flushdns, pinged google servers(62ms), pinged riot servers(112ms), uninstalled, reinstalled, got rid of the logitech file(mouse i use), i use windows 10 and everything else works wonderfully. i turn off all needless apps, and deleted those i dont use at all, freed up  RAM(helped with fps, uncapped i can get up to 120ish). Alternately on EUW my ping only fluctuated between 160ms and 300ms, which is curious. use command prompt and type"tracert (insert ipaddress)to check the journey of your data. im trying to reduce packet loss but i oubt that will help. #lagcity #bronzelifeforlife #riotlovesLCS #idontneedthestress
Well, i had packet loss from my ISP's end; but they fixed that 3 days ago. I saw this thread, and i found it interesting, as i experience the same issues. So sorry i cant help you mate.
Yeah so you have the ping issue too?

Hey guys, I also have these issues... one year later... same thing... I also talked with a bunch of friends and they have the same issue at the same time I do. To be mentioned that we don't use the same internet provider. As a quick reminder, having a call through skype seems to stabilize the connection...It's just wonderful that RIOT has the same issues 1 fking year later... They give 0 interest about their customers, thank you RIOT!

> [{quoted}](name=AFK Reaper,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=OrY6s7hX,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2016-03-26T01:50:42.269+0000)
>
> Yeah so you have the ping issue too?

Yes brother.  But since 2-3 months ago :(

Same Issue. I have checked everything on my end and did a traceroute. Looks like my end is fine, and internet is fine.
Trouble starts when hitting the routers that service the region I happen to be in to League of Legends as evidenced by Leagueoflegends.com and LOLking.com both having the same drop off in the same area, yet other sites such as google.com have 0 issues connecting. I have checked others such as Yahoo, Bing, CNN, and Foxnews all with 0 issues connecting. The problem is definetly related to the router that is set up for the region I am in. 

At this point, the way that router is reacting, it makes this game unplayable as it causes ping times to go from 49 ms jumping up to over 19k ms or more even causing disconnections all together.
Here's a copy of some trace routes with my IP Address Redacted for Privacy purposes.
I am going to throw this in my support ticket as well.

Sorry im not too tech savy but what im getting is that this is riots fault correct?
It means that riot server and lolking doesnt react/cuts you off connection at random
Ping spikes have been happening to me for months. I have recorded proof too. My last match had an sharp spike from 46 to 533. Took about half a minute before it calmed down.
its so hard to play like that. Whats the coincidence that I started laggin to hell right after I downloaded the patch
SAME! I played earlier in the year, just fine. 2 days ago downloaded the path and that happens.

Yes! I just came back to the game after a couple of months. I used to be just normal 30 something ping and flat 60 fps until yesterday I downloaded all the patches and got into a game. Ping was perfect up until 2 or 3 mins into the game and then it stayed mostly from 200- 900 and rarely went back to normal ping only a few seconds of clarity and bliss. I never have internet issues with other games before even recent ones I play like CSGO or Overwatch or BDO, I also did the testmywifi.net or something like that thingy and my results came back fine right as I got out of the laggy game. . . I can't play the game if it isn't fixed :( because it is a shame since I was just trying to get back!
Having the same issues and its super annoying. Today my ping was in the 1000's. It actually hit above 4000 close to 5000. It wasnt like this before. Im located in Texas

Me too. Test my internet and got only 12ping. Go in to the game and get 500 and Dc after 5 min! 
I always got 20 ping before this patch! {{item:3070}} {{champion:32}} {{item:3070}}
I talked to my isp and everything is good on my end. They checked for packet loss, reset my router twice and it still happens. Riot is the reason this is happening. I have confirmed that
RIOT PLZ NOTICED THIS SH*T! AND FIX IT PLZ
Seriously!

I'm having the same problem. I usually have a 60 ping but here recently it's been shooting up to 300 - 500 hundred (depending entirely on what I am doing in game). I didn't have this problem till patch 6.6 and it's insane, it makes the game unplayable. I was really worried it was me glad to know it isn't. (Went through a whole bunch of troubleshooting steps to discover it wasn't my network.)
Bump!!
same problem lately.
ruins the game
